intro: Lactuca capensis, commonly known as Cape lettuce, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with upright stems and serrated, dark green leaves. Its flowers are small and yellow, arranged in a cluster, and it produces small, oval-shaped seeds. Lactuca capensis is often found in grasslands and along roadsides, thriving in well-drained soils.
